news.headline: FlyJetr is catering to first-time private jet travelers with unmatched access and convenience, leading a transformative shift in the industry.
news.summary: Young travelers are increasingly choosing FlyJetr for unparalleled access and convenience in luxury jet charter services. The company, based in Miami, is setting new standards in the private aviation sector by attracting a significant number of first-time flyers. This transformative trend is evident in the sharp increase in bookings, with an impressive 30% rise over the past year. FlyJetr is redefining the travel experience for these young customers, offering them a class above the rest in terms of comfort and flexibility.

news.headline: Mural appoints Bill Dwoinen as Chief Revenue Officer to accelerate global growth, announced on Feb. 4, 2025.
news.summary: Mural, a visual work platform facilitating teamwork, has enhanced its executive leadership by appointing Bill Dwoinen as the new Chief Revenue Officer (CRO), in San Francisco on February 4, 2025. The platform aims to boost global expansion efforts by leveraging Dwoinen's expertise.

news.headline: OceanSound promotes 3, hires 8 in tech investments, managing $4.4B in assets, invested in 10 platforms.
news.summary: OceanSound Partners, a private equity firm focusing on technology and technology-enabled services for government and regulated markets, revealed the promotion of three individuals and the addition of eight new members across its investment, portfolio ownership, and operations teams in New York. Currently overseeing more than $4.4 billion in Regulatory Assets Under Management, OceanSound has made investments in ten platform companies.

news.headline: BioFlyte gets SBIR Phase I contract from U.S. Air Force to advance aerosol Chem/Biothreat tech for critical infrastructure.
news.summary: A company based in Albuquerque, New Mexico, BioFlyte, has recently secured a Phase I contract from AFWERX Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR). The contract is specifically aimed at their BioTOF z200 project.

news.headline: Nature's Path introduces Love Crunch Protein Granola with two new varieties, adding protein to indulgent flavors - U.S. launch. #OrganicFood #Snacks #ProteinGranola
news.summary: A popular organic food brand has unveiled two new granola flavors that combine rich taste with protein-packed nutrition for on-the-go snacking. Nature's Path, the biggest organic breakfast and snack food producer in North America, revealed the release of the products. The announcement was made in Vancouver, BC on February 4, 2025.

news.headline: Lennox and Samsung partner to launch new mini-split and VRF product lineups, combining expertise in HVAC technology.
news.summary: Dallas, February 4, 2025 - Lennox, a renowned company in providing climate control solutions for residential and commercial use, along with Samsung, a globally recognized leader in HVAC technology, have joined forces to create ductless heating and cooling solutions. The collaboration combines the expertise and reputation of both brands to offer efficient climate control options. The partnership between Lennox and Samsung aims to provide customers with top-notch products that cater to their heating and cooling needs.

news.headline: SimpliSafe® receives AVS-01 certification from UL, the third in industry. Improving emergency response. BOSTON, Feb. 4, 2025.
news.summary: SimpliSafe has recently earned its third Underwriters Laboratories (UL) certification following the release of the Standard, making it one of only three security organizations to achieve this milestone. This certification showcases SimpliSafe's dedication to public safety and operational quality. The accomplishment was announced in Boston on February 4, 2025, as reported by PRNewswire. This achievement highlights SimpliSafe's commitment to adhering to the highest standards and ensuring its products meet strict safety protocols.

news.headline: New firm LuxMed Transition Strategies, backed by Professional Transition Strategies, meets demand for practice transitions in medical aesthetics and wellness. Industry-leading expertise offered in the aesthetic and wellness practice market.
news.summary: LuxMed Transition Strategies, a leading firm in practice transitions for medical aesthetics, has partnered with Professional Transition Strategies to bring top-notch expertise to the aesthetic and wellness practice market. This collaboration was announced in Dallas on February 4, 2025. LuxMed aims to offer industry-leading services in this sector, ensuring seamless transitions for their clients.

news.headline: PayPal beats revenue and EPS estimates in Q4, with $8.37 billion revenue and $1.19 EPS. $15 billion buyback announced.
news.summary: PayPal Holdings Inc (NASDAQ: PYPL) saw a 4% growth in their fiscal fourth-quarter revenue, reaching $8.37 billion, surpassing the analyst consensus of $8.26 billion. The company also reported an adjusted EPS of $1.19, higher than the expected $1.12. Despite the positive results, the stock declined post announcement. Total payment volumes rose by 7% year-over-year, reaching $437.8 billion for the quarter. However, payment transactions decreased by 3% to $6.6 billion. This data comes in the midst of global interest in AI, with Sam Altman from OpenAI looking towards collaborating with major companies like Samsung, SK Hynix, and SoftBank. For more details, the full story is available on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Dubai seeks $500 million from construction firm IPO.
Supernus Pharmaceuticals received FDA approval for ONAPGO™ for Parkinson's Disease, available in Q2 2025 with nurse education support.
news.summary: In Rockville, Maryland, on February 4, 2025, Supernus Pharmaceuticals, Inc. (Nasdaq: SUPN), a biopharmaceutical company specializing in treatments for central nervous system disorders, shared that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has granted approval for ONAPGO (apomorphine hydrochloride) injection, previously identified as SPN-830. This marks it as the pioneering subcutaneous apomorphine infusion device sanctioned for managing motor fluctuations in adults afflicted with advanced Parkinson’s disease (PD). ONAPGO is set to be released in the second quarter of 2025 along with a dedicated team of experts, which includes an extensive nurse education initiative and launch-time support services.

news.headline: Roadzen reduces $5.5m short-term liabilities by paying $1.65m in cash & $12.6m in 6 months using cash & shares.
news.summary: In the past six months, Roadzen successfully cleared $12.6 million in short-term liabilities. This was achieved by using $1.65 million in cash and issuing around 1.2 million ordinary shares valued at $2.80 per share.

news.headline: Kenco's survey on Supply Chain Innovation reveals varying views on AI's impact in shaping 2025 strategies.
news.summary: In Chattanooga, Tennessee, Kenco, a top third-party logistics provider, has unveiled the findings of its 2025 Supply Chain Innovation report.

news.headline: Clover supports Superdome and small businesses in New Orleans during Big Game, powering pay and delighting fans.
news.summary: Milwaukee – The prominent all-in-one point-of-sale solution, Clover, is fully embracing the "small" aspect during the most significant week in football. As the Big Game approaches in New Orleans, a hub for food and culture, tens of thousands of fans and tourists are expected to gather. Clover will play a substantial role in supporting the Superdome and small businesses during this event, facilitating transactions for fans, boosting enthusiasm, and enhancing the overall experience for attendees. This initiative highlights Clover's commitment to empowering small businesses and maximizing the potential of the event as it converges on New Orleans.

news.headline: Highnote partners with Fasten Rewards for new consumer credit card program, rewarding auto loan/lease payments.
news.summary: In San Francisco, Highnote, a prominent modern card platform manager, revealed the introduction of a fresh consumer credit card initiative in collaboration with Fasten Rewards. Through utilizing Highnote’s adaptable platform, Fasten is striving to enhance the connection between drivers and dealerships by offering a unique credit card program. This program rewards consumers for auto loan or lease payments, simultaneously boosting dealership loyalty, engagement, and sales velocity. The consumer revolving credit program is designed to cater to the needs of both parties, ultimately fostering stronger relationships within the automotive industry.

news.headline: Zuora named leader in recurring billing solutions in Forrester report; highest score in Revenue Recognition.
news.summary: In Redwood City, California, Zuora, Inc. (NYSE: ZUO) has been recognized as a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Recurring Billing Solutions, Q1 2025. They achieved the highest score in the Revenue Recognition category according to the report. The report highlighted Zuora's aggressive product vision and strategy focusing on providing integrated solutions to enhance subscriber experience and revenue management.

news.headline: Bounty returns to Radio Row at Super Bowl LIX with House of Wingman serving tens of thousands of chicken wings.
news.summary: Bounty Paper Towels is set to make a splash at Super Bowl LIX with the return of the House of Wingman event in New Orleans. Taking place from February 3 to 7, 2025, at the Earnest N. Morial Convention Center, the event will feature tens of thousands of chicken wings to cater to reporters on Radio Row. The iconic NFL duos will also be in attendance to add to the excitement. The event showcases the idea that football and wings go hand-in-hand.

news.headline: Olo partners with FreedomPay and Stripe to enhance in-store payments for restaurants. Collaboration to accelerate adoption.
news.summary: A prominent restaurant technology provider, Olo (NYSE:OLO), recently disclosed a strategic collaboration with FreedomPay to enhance restaurant payment experiences across the country. This partnership serves to strengthen Olo's ties with Stripe, a financial infrastructure platform, enabling in-person transaction processing. Olo Pay, introduced in 2022 with Stripe as its initial digital payments partner, signifies a significant advancement in the realm of restaurant payment solutions.

news.headline: Nitrogen appoints Rachel Cameron as Managing Director of Partnerships, known for her work at SS&C Black Diamond & DPL Financial.
news.summary: In Auburn, California, Nitrogen (formerly Riskalyze), a prominent developer of software for advisors in risk tolerance, proposal generation, investment research, and planning, named Rachel Cameron as the new head of partnerships. Cameron, with a background in partner strategy within financial technology, has held key positions at SS&C Black Diamond Wealth Platform and DPL Financial Partners. Notable for her contribution, she will oversee partnerships in her new role.

news.headline: Victor Capital Partners invests in B-O-F Corporation to drive growth and innovation in retail sectors, focusing on unique beverage and specialty shelving offerings.
news.summary: A prominent middle market private equity firm, Victor Capital Partners, has revealed their recent investment in B-O-F Corporation, a company in the industrial technology sector. In collaboration with senior management, Victor Capital will be supporting B-O-F in providing specialized beverage and shelving solutions to various retailers like grocery stores, convenience stores, and mass merchants. This move signifies Victor Capital's strategic focus on partnering with branded businesses, emphasizing their commitment to sectors such as industrial technology, specialty consumer goods, and business services.

news.headline: S&S Activewear invests in Canadian division with new structure and leadership appointments, effective Feb 1, 2025. Craig Ryan appointed as VP of commercial.
news.summary: S&S Activewear, a prominent distributor of apparel and accessories in North America, is strengthening its presence in Canada by making substantial investments in its Canadian division. They have recently unveiled a new commercial structure and key leadership appointments, set to take effect on Feb. 1, 2025. In order to boost growth and improve customer assistance, Craig Ryan will assume the role of vice president of commercial operations. This move demonstrates S&S Activewear's dedication to the Canadian market.

news.headline: Motorsport Games Inc. (NASDAQ: MSGM) releases preliminary 2024 results and business updates.
news.summary: Miami, on February 4th, 2025 - A prominent racing game developer and publisher, Motorsport Games Inc. (NASDAQ: MSGM), declared various updates regarding its operations, finances, and overall business.

news.headline: Collaboration between STMicroelectronics and HighTec EDV-Systeme aims to enhance software-defined vehicles' safety.
news.summary: In the latest report, it was revealed that the unemployment rate had dropped to 4%, the lowest in a decade. The economy added 250,000 jobs in the past month, surpassing expectations. The stock market also saw a significant increase, with the main indexes rising by 3% on average. Additionally, inflation remained steady at 2%, providing further stability to the economy. Experts are optimistic about the future outlook, citing the strong performance as a sign of continued growth. Overall, the economic indicators point towards a positive trend in the coming months.

news.headline: Femasys gets Israeli regulatory approvals for FemaSeed female infertility treatment and two diagnostic devices.
news.summary: Following the announcement of FemaSeed's U.S. FDA clearance in September 2023 and EU CE mark approval in June 2024, the regulatory approval process has been completed. The U.S. FDA clearance of FemaSeed was announced in September 2023, and the EU CE mark approval was announced in June 2024.

news.headline: SiMa.ai achieves "Awardable" status in DoD's Tradewinds Solutions Marketplace, accelerating AI adoption.
news.summary: In San Jose, California, SiMa.ai, a company specializing in software-centric, embedded edge machine learning system-on-chip (MLSoC), revealed today that it has attained “Awardable” recognition from the Chief Digital and Artificial Intelligence Office (CDAO) through the Tradewinds Solutions Marketplace. This marketplace is a key component of Tradewinds, the Department of Defense's (DoD's) platform that aims to expedite the acquisition and integration of Artificial Intelligence technologies.

news.headline: eBots & Foxconn set new record in adaptive manufacturing. eBots-IDO-02 passes FAT, shifting to full automation. Strategic partnership formed in 2023.
news.summary: Today, eBots Inc of Fremont, California, revealed that their eBots-IDO-02 embodied AI robot for smart manufacturing has passed Foxconn’s factory acceptance test. This marks a crucial step towards fully automating electronics manufacturing and signifies the growing collaboration between the two companies. The strategic partnership, established in 2023, emphasizes resource sharing, mutual benefit, and collective growth. This achievement highlights the potential of integrating sophisticated technology in manufacturing processes, moving towards greater efficiency and innovation.

news.headline: CIRANDA launches e-commerce site ciranda.com, offers organic, non-GMO, fair trade ingredients. More streamlined experience.
news.summary: CIRANDA, a leading supplier of certified organic, non-GMO, and fair trade food ingredients in North America, has introduced its new e-commerce platform, ciranda.com. The website serves as a comprehensive hub for customers, offering access to ingredient details, ordering capabilities, documentation, and account management tools all in one place. This initiative aims to enhance customer experience by providing a more efficient and streamlined process. The launch of the website comes as part of CIRANDA's commitment to offering convenient and accessible services to its clientele.

news.headline: Cycode introduces Change Impact Analysis tech, leading ASPM market with multiple Fortune 100 customers.
news.summary: In San Francisco, Cycode, a frontrunner in Application Security Posture Management (ASPM), revealed the debut of its revolutionary Change Impact Analysis (CIA) technology as part of its Complete ASPM platform. This new solution enables companies to preemptively evaluate the security consequences of all code adjustments, helping them to swiftly and effectively recognize, rank, and resolve vulnerabilities. By gaining insights into the impact of code modifications on risk, organizations can enhance their ability to respond to threats significantly.

news.headline: Agritask rebrands as Acclym, offering data-led agricultural solutions for food & beverage companies. CEO Amir Lehr leads the transition.
news.summary: Agritask, a company specializing in crop supply intelligence, has announced a major rebranding and will now be known as Acclym. Under the new name, Acclym will focus on providing data-driven agricultural sourcing solutions specifically tailored for food and beverage companies. CEO Amir Lehr emphasized that the rebranding represents a significant shift for the company, signaling its expansion beyond crop management. Acclym aims to bring innovative solutions to the agriculture industry with a strong focus on leveraging data for improved sourcing processes.

news.headline: CertifID report reveals first-time homeowners are 3x more likely to be victims of real estate wire fraud, with losses growing from $9M to $446M annually in less than a decade, according to IC3.
news.summary: In Austin, Texas and Grand Rapids, Michigan, CertifID, a key player in safeguarding against wire fraud, unveiled its third yearly State of Wire Fraud report on Tuesday. This report stands as the primary source of information regarding the risks faced by American consumers in real estate dealings. Real estate wire fraud has skyrocketed by 50 times in under ten years, surging from $9 million to $446 million in yearly losses as reported to the FBI Internet Crime Complaint Center (IC3). The housing industry has experienced a surge in cybercrime activity, largely due to a frequently occurring issue.

news.headline: Beer industry contributes $878 billion to global GDP in 2023, 0.8% of total GDP. Study covers 185 countries in detail.
news.summary: A recent report from the World Brewing Alliance (WBA) disclosed that the beer industry made an extraordinary contribution of $878 billion to the worldwide GDP in 2023, accounting for approximately 0.8% of the total global GDP. This data, compiled by Oxford Economics, is part of the most extensive research ever conducted on the economic influence of the brewing sector, encompassing data from 185 countries with a detailed analysis of 76 nations. The report serves as a comprehensive worldwide assessment of the industry's impact from the initial raw materials stage through to the final product.

news.headline: In 2024, Intradiem achieved record results and is set for more growth in 2025.
news.summary: Atlanta-based company Intradiem has announced significant achievements in the past year, showcasing remarkable growth and innovation. The company has surpassed key milestones and established new industry benchmarks, marking a successful period of advancement.

news.headline: Edifecs unveils Healthcare Interoperability Cloud in Bellevue, WA to boost Strategic Interoperability in healthcare.
news.summary: A technology company recently unveiled the Healthcare Interoperability Cloud in Bellevue, Washington. Edifecs introduced this innovation to empower Strategic Interoperability, showcasing its commitment to enhancing healthcare data exchange. This development aims to streamline interoperability processes within the healthcare sector, fostering efficient communication and information sharing. The launch of the Healthcare Interoperability Cloud represents a significant step towards improving connectivity within the industry.

news.headline: Alan Chhabra appointed EVP of Worldwide Partnerships at Cerebras Systems, to expand partner ecosystem and drive AI tech adoption.
news.summary: Cerebras Systems, based in Sunnyvale, California, has named Alan Chhabra as EVP of Worldwide Partnerships. Chhabra will be responsible for managing the global partner ecosystem for Cerebras and enhancing strategic relationships across various industries to promote the adoption of Cerebras’ innovative AI technology. This appointment comes at a crucial juncture as Cerebras focuses on expanding globally and establishing new strategic collaborations.

news.headline: ZipRecruiter to release Q4 and full year 2024 financial results on February 25, 2025. Conference call at 2:00pm PT.
news.summary: ZipRecruiter, a prominent online employment platform listed on NYSE under the ticker ZIP, disclosed their upcoming financial results for the quarter and full year concluding on December 31, 2024. The announcement mentioned that on Tuesday, February 25, 2025, the company will conduct a conference call and webcast at 2:00pm PT (5:00pm ET) to delve into their business and financial performance. This event is set to cover the details of ZipRecruiter's Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Earnings Conference Call.

news.headline: Pediatrica Health Group partners with M33 Growth to revolutionize pediatric primary care with modern technology.
news.summary: A Boston investment firm, M33 Growth, has partnered with healthcare executive Roberto L. Palenzuela to transform pediatric primary care. This collaboration has led to the creation of Pediatrica Health Group, aiming to revolutionize the industry with a Next Generation Care℠ experience. By leveraging modern technology, the company seeks to empower providers and healthcare teams to enhance the care provided to families.

news.headline: Warren Kohm named CEO of Special Aerospace Services (SAS), replacing Heather Bulk. Godspeed Capital backed SAS.
news.summary: Aerospace company Special Aerospace Services (SAS) in Huntsville, Alabama, has appointed Warren S. Kohm as its new Chief Executive Officer. This appointment comes as SAS is backed by Godspeed Capital Management LP. Warren S. Kohm takes over from Heather Bulk, who was the Co-founder, President, and CEO of SAS. Heather Bulk will now serve as the Vice Chairman of the company. Special Aerospace Services specializes in space, hypersonics, and missile defense technologies, providing engineering solutions, hardware, and critical mission communications.

news.headline: Ministry Brands appoints Jamshed Patel as new CTO, boasting 20 years of experience to elevate product development.
news.summary: In Atlanta, Ministry Brands, a prominent church software and online giving solutions provider, has recently named Jamshed Patel as its Chief Technology Officer (CTO). Patel brings more than 20 years of executive expertise to the role, making him a highly qualified technology strategist poised to enhance Ministry Brands’ product advancement and industry visibility. Expressing his excitement, Patel stated, “I am thrilled to be part of Ministry Brands during this critical phase of its expansion."

news.headline: Capstone Companies, Inc. receives increased financial support from Coppermine Ventures, LLC, increasing total funding from $125,914 to $485,163.
news.summary: Capstone Companies, Inc. (OTCQB: CAPC) in Deerfield Beach, Florida, has received a boost in working capital funding from Coppermine Ventures, LLC (Coppermine). An Amended and Restated Promissory Note, effective January 29, 2025, has upped the total funding available to Capstone from $125,914 to $485,163. This new financing replaces a previous promissory note from October 31, 2024. The increase in funds will support the company's ongoing operations and growth plans.

news.headline: Old El Paso™ partners with football stars J.J. Watt & Jason Kelce for new Caramel Dessert Taco Shells launch.
news.summary: In Minneapolis, the popular brand Old El Paso has introduced a new product just in time for a major football weekend. The company has launched the Old El Paso Caramel Dessert Taco Shells, in collaboration with football stars J.J. Watt and Jason Kelce. This treat follows the success of their initial Dessert Taco Shells release, aiming to elevate game-day snacking. The product comes as a follow-up to their first dessert taco shells and promises to be a hit with fans.

news.headline: Whipshots® and Cardi B. introduce Cardi Gras to elevate game day parties; celebrate with vodka-infused whipped cream.
news.summary: In Los Angeles, Starco Brands revealed that Whipshots®, the innovative vodka-infused whipped cream product co-created by renowned star Cardi B., is introducing Cardi Gras, a festivity channeling the essence of New Orleans nationwide. As stated by Cardi B., the co-founder of Whipshots, "Mardi Gras is a time of joy and revelry. With Whipshots, the party doesn't have to end on Mardi - now you can have Cardi all year round to elevate your celebrations." Starco Brands is listed on OTCQB as STCB.

news.headline: Medical company Turnstone Biologics to investigate strategic options.Characters: 59
Intuit partners with NFL at Super Bowl LIX to promote financial literacy, aiming to educate 50 million learners by 2030.
news.summary: A plan has been announced by the company based in Mountain View, California to boost financial literacy in the United States. Intuit aims to achieve this by providing 50 million students with access to Intuit for Education by the year 2030.

news.headline: Dror Ortho-Design partners with Aran R&D in a strategic alliance. AI-powered orthodontic solutions. OTCPINK: DROR.
PPG plans to continue COLORFUL COMMUNITIES initiative until 2035.
news.summary: In a recent report, it was stated that the unemployment rate in the country has dropped to 4.5%, which is the lowest it has been in the past five years. The report also highlighted that the economy has added 250,000 new jobs in the last quarter alone. Additionally, it was noted that the construction industry saw the most significant growth, with a 6% increase in job opportunities. Experts predict that this positive trend is expected to continue in the coming months as the economy continues to recover from the impact of the pandemic.

news.headline: Elevance Health Foundation pledges $150 million over 5 years to support under-resourced communities' needs.
news.summary: The Elevance Health Foundation in Indianapolis has unveiled a fresh, five-year initiative with a significant investment of $150 million to tackle the health and social disparities in underprivileged regions. This latest strategy builds upon the Foundation's successful work over the past three years and aims to enhance its impact on improving community well-being through various approaches. These include grant disbursement, impactful investments, engaging with local communities, and a novel Community Action program.

news.headline: Globex Mining reports metallurgical progress on two properties, updates shareholders on test work.
news.summary: Globex Mining Enterprises Inc, based in Rouyn-Noranda, Quebec, announced progress on metallurgical test work for two royalty properties. The company's current stock exchange listings include GMX on the Toronto Stock Exchange, and G1MN on various European exchanges such as Frankfurt and Stuttgart. Additionally, it is listed as GLBXF on the OTCQX International in the US. The update was provided on Feb. 04, 2025, offering shareholders key insights into the ongoing developments at the company.

news.headline: Capacity, an AI support platform, acquires YouCanBookMe to boost scheduling capabilities, announced on Feb. 4, 2025 via PRNewswire.
news.summary: A support automation platform powered by AI, called Capacity, has recently acquired YouCanBookMe to enhance its scheduling functions. The acquisition took place in St. Louis on February 4, 2025. This move will enable Capacity users to benefit from the technology brought in by YouCanBookMe, with an aim to improve their scheduling capabilities. This acquisition signifies an important development in the tech industry, with implications for both companies' user bases.

news.headline: Hims & Hers launches Health Collective and Community Member Council to enhance customer personalized health experience.
news.summary: In San Francisco, the prominent health and wellness platform, Hims & Hers Health, Inc. (NYSE: HIMS), unveiled two innovative initiatives aimed at providing enhanced personalized services to its customer base. These programs, the Hims & Hers Health Collective and the Hims & Hers Community Member Council, were created to empower customers to actively participate in shaping their healthcare journey. Embodying the company's commitment, these groups aim to include clients in decision-making processes and offer tailored experiences.

news.headline: Dill Dinkers® partners with Pickleball Central to enhance player experience in clubs nationwide. Collaboration announced on Feb. 4, 2025.
news.summary: A prominent indoor pickleball club franchise, Dill Dinkers, based in Columbia, Md., declared a significant development on February 4, 2025. The franchise, well-known for its rapid growth and industry leadership, revealed a new collaboration. This partnership involves integrating specialized pickleball products into their clubs across the nation. This move aims to enhance the pickleball experience for their members and customers.
